Araghaṭṭa，[Sk．araghaṭṭaka （so Halāyudha，see Aufrecht p．138），dialect．] a wheel for raising water from a well Bdgh．on cakkavaṭṭaka at CV．V，16，2 （Vin．II，318）．So read for T．arahatta-ghaṭi-yanta acc to Morris，J．P．T．S．1885，30; cp．also Vin．Texts III，112．-- The 2<sup>rd</sup> part of the cpd．is doubtful; Morris & Aufrecht compare the modern Hindī form arhaṭ or rahaṭ “a well-wheel”．（Page 76）
